page.title: 18MEDIA..NEWSPAPER REPORT
page.content: {Fife Herald, Friday 31st.May 1985} The Scottish Agricultural Wages Board met to discuss a claim by the Workers' Representatives for an increase in the minimum general farmworker rate to Â£130 per week with a pro rata increase for all other wage rates. The Board proposed an increase for all other wage rates.The Board proposed an increase of Â£6 a week (7.2%)and proportionate increased for all other weeks.The allowance for the keep of sherperds' dogs is up from Â£2.17 a week per dog to Â£2.28 a week per dog.The Board also agreed that the following items should be provided as weather protective clothing..... wellington boots,coat,leggings and gloves.A reduction in the working week to 35 hours and an increase in annual holidays were rejected by the employers.
